source.eb51a810:
# 3.1 Styling Bar chart

fig, ax = plt.subplots()
bars = ax.bar(blood_type, counts,edgecolor = '#ffbfd8', color = '#fc126c',linewidth = 5)
ax.set_title("Blood Data",fontsize = 20)
ax.set_xlabel("Blood Type")

plt.show()
source.b17b6137:
# 3.2 Styling Pie chart
fig1, ax1 = plt.subplots()
colors = ["#f5166b","#9d87ff","#29f2a2","#ffc629","#30d9e6"]
ax1.pie(counts, labels=blood_type,autopct='%1.1f%%',shadow=True,startangle=90,colors = colors ,explode = (0.1,0,0,0))
plt.show()

array = np.random.normal(170, 10, 300)
fig, ax = plt.subplots()

Bar charts are mainly used for comparing variables, while histograms are used for showing the distribution of variables. 
##### Histograms plot quantitative data.
##### Bar charts plot categorical data.
